trans-unit.source: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Linux-based HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Linux-based HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop Java MapReduce programs and deploy them to Linux-based HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop Java MapReduce programs and deploy them to Linux-based HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This documents walks you through using Apache Maven to create a MapReduce application, then deploy and run it on a Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This documents walks you through using Apache Maven to create a MapReduce application, then deploy and run it on a Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on using a Windows-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster, see [Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop on HDInsight (Windows)](hdinsight-develop-deploy-java-mapreduce.md)
trans-unit.target: For information on using a Windows-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster, see [Develop Java MapReduce programs for Hadoop on HDInsight (Windows)](hdinsight-develop-deploy-java-mapreduce.md)

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: [Java JDK](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/) 7 or later (or an equivalent, such as OpenJDK)
trans-unit.target: [Java JDK](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/) 7 or later (or an equivalent, such as OpenJDK)

trans-unit.source: [Apache Maven](http://maven.apache.org/)
trans-unit.target: [Apache Maven](http://maven.apache.org/)

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**

trans-unit.source: **Azure CLI**: For more information, see [Install and configure Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md)
trans-unit.target: **Azure CLI**: For more information, see [Install and configure Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md)

trans-unit.source: Configure environment variables
trans-unit.target: Configure environment variables

trans-unit.source: The following environment variables may be set when you install Java and the JDK.
trans-unit.target: The following environment variables may be set when you install Java and the JDK.

trans-unit.source: However, you should check that they exist and that they contain the correct values for your system.
trans-unit.target: However, you should check that they exist and that they contain the correct values for your system.

trans-unit.source: **JAVA_HOME** - should point to the directory where the Java runtime environment (JRE) is installed.
trans-unit.target: **JAVA_HOME** - should point to the directory where the Java runtime environment (JRE) is installed.

trans-unit.source: For example, in a OS X, Unix or Linux system, it should have a value similar to `/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle`.
trans-unit.target: For example, in a OS X, Unix or Linux system, it should have a value similar to `/usr/lib/jvm/java-7-oracle`.

trans-unit.source: In Windows, it would have a value similar to `c:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.7`
trans-unit.target: In Windows, it would have a value similar to `c:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre1.7`

trans-unit.source: **PATH** - should contain the following paths:
trans-unit.target: **PATH** - should contain the following paths:

trans-unit.source: **JAVA_HOME** (or the equivalent path)
trans-unit.target: **JAVA_HOME** (or the equivalent path)

trans-unit.source: **JAVA_HOME\bin** (or the equivalent path)
trans-unit.target: **JAVA_HOME\bin** (or the equivalent path)

trans-unit.source: The directory where Maven is installed
trans-unit.target: The directory where Maven is installed

trans-unit.source: Create a new Maven project
trans-unit.target: Create a new Maven project

trans-unit.source: From a terminal session, or command line in your development environment, change directories to the location you want to store this project.
trans-unit.target: From a terminal session, or command line in your development environment, change directories to the location you want to store this project.

trans-unit.source: Use the __mvn__ command, which is installed with Maven, to generate the scaffolding for the project.
trans-unit.target: Use the __mvn__ command, which is installed with Maven, to generate the scaffolding for the project.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new directory in the current directory, with the name specified by the __artifactID__ parameter (**wordcountjava** in this example.) This directory will contain the following items:
trans-unit.target: This will create a new directory in the current directory, with the name specified by the __artifactID__ parameter (**wordcountjava** in this example.) This directory will contain the following items:

trans-unit.source: __pom.xml__ - The [Project Object Model (POM)](http://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-the-pom.html) that contains information and configuration details used to build the project.
trans-unit.target: __pom.xml__ - The [Project Object Model (POM)](http://maven.apache.org/guides/introduction/introduction-to-the-pom.html) that contains information and configuration details used to build the project.

trans-unit.source: __src__ - The directory that contains the __main/java/org/apache/hadoop/examples__ directory, where you will author the application.
trans-unit.target: __src__ - The directory that contains the __main/java/org/apache/hadoop/examples__ directory, where you will author the application.

trans-unit.source: Delete the __src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/examples/apptest.java__ file, as it will not be used in this example.
trans-unit.target: Delete the __src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/examples/apptest.java__ file, as it will not be used in this example.

trans-unit.source: Add dependencies
trans-unit.target: Add dependencies

trans-unit.source: Edit the __pom.xml__ file and add the following inside the `<dependencies>` section:
trans-unit.target: Edit the __pom.xml__ file and add the following inside the `<dependencies>` section:

trans-unit.source: This tells Maven that the project requires the libraries (listed within <artifactId\>) with a specific version (listed within <version\>).
trans-unit.target: This tells Maven that the project requires the libraries (listed within <artifactId\>) with a specific version (listed within <version\>).

trans-unit.source: At compile time, this will be downloaded from the default Maven repository.
trans-unit.target: At compile time, this will be downloaded from the default Maven repository.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Maven repository search](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Corg.apache.hadoop%7Chadoop-mapreduce-examples%7C2.5.1%7Cjar) to view more.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Maven repository search](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Corg.apache.hadoop%7Chadoop-mapreduce-examples%7C2.5.1%7Cjar) to view more.

trans-unit.source: The `<scope>provided</scope>` tells Maven that these dependencies should not be packaged with the application, as they will be provided by the HDInsight cluster at run-time.
trans-unit.target: The `<scope>provided</scope>` tells Maven that these dependencies should not be packaged with the application, as they will be provided by the HDInsight cluster at run-time.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to the __pom.xml__ file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following to the __pom.xml__ file.

trans-unit.source: This must be inside the `<project>...</project>` tags in the file; for example, between `</dependencies>` and `</project>`.
trans-unit.target: This must be inside the `<project>...</project>` tags in the file; for example, between `</dependencies>` and `</project>`.

trans-unit.source: The first plugin configures the [Maven Shade Plugin](http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/), which is used to build an uberjar (sometimes called a fatjar), which contains dependencies required by the application.
trans-unit.target: The first plugin configures the [Maven Shade Plugin](http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-shade-plugin/), which is used to build an uberjar (sometimes called a fatjar), which contains dependencies required by the application.

trans-unit.source: It also prevents duplication of licenses within the jar package, which can cause problems on some systems.
trans-unit.target: It also prevents duplication of licenses within the jar package, which can cause problems on some systems.

trans-unit.source: The second plugin configures the Maven compiler, which is used to set the version of Java required by this application to the version used on the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The second plugin configures the Maven compiler, which is used to set the version of Java required by this application to the version used on the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Save the __pom.xml__ file.
trans-unit.target: Save the __pom.xml__ file.

trans-unit.source: Create the MapReduce application
trans-unit.target: Create the MapReduce application

trans-unit.source: Go to the __wordcountjava/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/examples__ directory and rename the __App.java__ file to __WordCount.java__.
trans-unit.target: Go to the __wordcountjava/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/examples__ directory and rename the __App.java__ file to __WordCount.java__.

trans-unit.source: Open the __WordCount.java__ file in a text editor and replace the contents with the following:
trans-unit.target: Open the __WordCount.java__ file in a text editor and replace the contents with the following:

trans-unit.source: Notice the package name is **org.apache.hadoop.examples** and the class name is **WordCount**.
trans-unit.target: Notice the package name is **org.apache.hadoop.examples** and the class name is **WordCount**.

trans-unit.source: You will use these names when you submit the MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: You will use these names when you submit the MapReduce job.

trans-unit.source: Save the file.
trans-unit.target: Save the file.

trans-unit.source: Build the application
trans-unit.target: Build the application

trans-unit.source: Change to the __wordcountjava__ directory, if you are not already there.
trans-unit.target: Change to the __wordcountjava__ directory, if you are not already there.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to build a JAR file containing the application:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to build a JAR file containing the application:

trans-unit.source: This will clean any previous build artifacts, download any dependencies that have not already been installed, and then build and package the application.
trans-unit.target: This will clean any previous build artifacts, download any dependencies that have not already been installed, and then build and package the application.

trans-unit.source: Once the command finishes, the __wordcountjava/target__ directory will contain a file named __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__.
trans-unit.target: Once the command finishes, the __wordcountjava/target__ directory will contain a file named __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__ file is an uberjar, which contains not only the WordCount job, but also dependencies that the job requires at runtime.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The __wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar__ file is an uberjar, which contains not only the WordCount job, but also dependencies that the job requires at runtime.

trans-unit.source: Upload the jar
trans-unit.target: Upload the jar

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to upload the jar file to the HDInsight headnode:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to upload the jar file to the HDInsight headnode:

trans-unit.source: This copies the files from the local system to the head node.
trans-unit.target: This copies the files from the local system to the head node.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you used a password to secure your SSH account, you will be prompted for the password.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you used a password to secure your SSH account, you will be prompted for the password.

trans-unit.source: If you used an SSH key, you may have to use the `-i` parameter and the path to the private key.
trans-unit.target: If you used an SSH key, you may have to use the `-i` parameter and the path to the private key.

trans-unit.source: For example, `scp -i /path/to/private/key wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `scp -i /path/to/private/key wordcountjava-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:`.

trans-unit.source: Run the MapReduce job
trans-unit.target: Run the MapReduce job

trans-unit.source: Connect to HDInsight using SSH as described in the following articles:
trans-unit.target: Connect to HDInsight using SSH as described in the following articles:

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: From the SSH session, use the following command to run the MapReduce application:
trans-unit.target: From the SSH session, use the following command to run the MapReduce application:

trans-unit.source: This will use the WordCount MapReduce application to count the words in the davinci.txt file, and store the results to __wasb:///example/data/wordcountout__.
trans-unit.target: This will use the WordCount MapReduce application to count the words in the davinci.txt file, and store the results to __wasb:///example/data/wordcountout__.

trans-unit.source: Both the input file and output are stored to the default storage for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Both the input file and output are stored to the default storage for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Once the job completes, use the following to view the results:
trans-unit.target: Once the job completes, use the following to view the results:

trans-unit.source: You should receive a list of words and counts, with values similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should receive a list of words and counts, with values similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this document, you have learned how to develop a Java MapReduce job.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you have learned how to develop a Java MapReduce job.

trans-unit.target: See the following documents for other ways to work with HDInsight.

trans-unit.target: [Use Hive with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-hive]

trans-unit.target: [Use Pig with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-pig]

trans-unit.target: [Use MapReduce with HDInsight](hdinsight-use-mapreduce.md)

trans-unit.target: For more information, see also the [Java Developer Center](https://azure.microsoft.com/develop/java/).
